remarks: If a word is a cyclically shifted word, and a second word is the result of cyclically shifting the same word, then the second word is the result of cyclically shifting the first word.  (Contributed by AV, 11-May-2018.)  (Revised by AV, 12-Jun-2018.)  (Proof shortened by AV, 3-Nov-2018.)
statement:
2cshwcshw $p |- ( ( Y e. Word V /\ ( # ` Y ) = N ) -> ( ( K e. ( 0 ... N ) /\ X = ( Y cyclShift K ) /\ E. m e. ( 0 ... N ) Z = ( Y cyclShift m ) ) -> E. n e. ( 0 ... N ) Z = ( X cyclShift n ) ) ) $.
$d K m n $.
$d N m n $.
$d V m n $.
$d X m n $.
$d Y m n $.
$d Z m n $.
